image.altText: Missing man David Aboui was last seen on London Circuit in Canberra on July 10 2012. Supplied: AFP

props.synopsis: Malak Arok was last seen leaving the ACT Watch House in July 2012.

title.children: 'We can't do anything': Family pleads for answers as search for Canberra man enters 12th year

image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann is able to appeal against the result of his failed defamation case, after a Federal Court judge dismissed an application for him to pay a security of costs before any appeal goes ahead.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann cleared to proceed with defamation case appeal

image.altText: Person with wings jumping off a pier.

props.synopsis: With Labor set to form government in the ACT, what exactly did the party promise voters during the election campaign?

title.children: Following Labor's victory, here's what they promised in the lead-up to the ACT election

image.altText: A building with mult-coloured exterior.

props.synopsis: Aleu Mapiou, found not guilty by reason of mental impairment to murdering another patient while inside the Canberra Hospital Adult Mental Health Unit, will be involuntarily detained at a secure mental health facility.

title.children: Canberra man found not guilty of murdering fellow mental health unit patient by reason of mental impairment

image.altText: Two credit card sized boxes with sexual health organisation logos, with an ultrasound probe cover in front.

props.synopsis: An independent review reveals a Canberra sexual health education organisation's mistaken distribution of more than 4,000 ultrasound probe covers as condoms was likely caused by an online ordering error.

title.children: Sexual health organisation's condom bungle caused by online ordering error

image.altText: A headshot of a serious-looking woman with short dark hair.

props.synopsis: Lovisa Sjoberg, 48, has not been seen for more than a week. Police were alerted to her disappearance when she failed to return a vehicle she had hired.

title.children: Rental car found in search for 'avid photographer' missing for more than a week in NSW Snowy Mountains

image.altText: Portrait of Shane Rattenbury sitting on a small wall with bushland down a mountain behind him.

props.synopsis: The ACT election saw the Greens go from six seats in the Legislative Assembly to three, with a fourth possible, but the swing against them was smaller than it appeared with the result being the party's third-best in ACT history.

title.children: ACT Greens still have 'very strong base' despite losing nearly half their Legislative Assembly seats

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks into multiple microphones.

props.synopsis: Re-elected MLA Jeremy Hanson says the party's seventh-straight election loss was "very disappointing", as conversations continue about Elizabeth Lee's leadership.

title.children: Jeremy Hanson confirms he will make bid for Canberra Liberals leadership, says the party has 'gone backwards'

image.altText: People walking across a courtyard surrounded by buildings.

props.synopsis: Vice-chancellor Stephen Parker says the University of Canberra is "spending beyond its means" and needs to save about $50 million in recurrent expenditure by the end of next year.

title.children: University of Canberra to cut 200 jobs as part of 'urgent and significant' cost-saving measures

image.altText: King Charles III chats with owner of alpaca.

props.synopsis: King Charles III and Queen Camilla have landed in Australia's capital as they begin their second official day of royal engagements.

title.children: King Charles III and Queen Camilla greet alpaca, given Tim Tams in Canberra as protester arrested

image.altText: A military personnel in green camouflage clothing stands holding a gun

props.synopsis: Israel's national security council calls on Israelis to immediately leave some tourist areas in southern Sri Lanka over the threat of a possible terrorist attack, with the US embassy issuing a similar warning.

title.children: Terror threat issued for Israelis in parts of Sri Lanka as local police raise security

image.altText: A woman with shoulder length brown hair wearing a printed blue top

props.synopsis: Gisele Pelicot, the alleged victim of rape by dozens of men in France, tells a court she is determined making her case public should help bring change in society.

title.children: 'This is not just my battle': Gisele Pelicot gives first testimony in France mass rape trial

image.altText: Two women with long blonde hair, smiling.

props.synopsis: Elle Macpherson went on Australian television and spoke about her holistic treatment to beat breast cancer. Behind the 'doctor' who helped her was a series of questionable qualifications.

title.children: 'Unbelievable': Oncologist questions claims of 'doctor' lauded by Elle Macpherson

image.altText: Newly built homes in a housing estate

props.synopsis: The state's building regulator has been exposed for failing to hold builders to account, prompting the government to replace the VBA with a new regulator with greater powers.

title.children: An independent review into the Victorian Building Authority finds it failed to protect homeowners trying to fix defects

image.altText: A 15-year-old girl sitting on a couch and looking at her phone.

props.synopsis: The federal government's proposed social media ban is likely to be detrimental to some teens, particularly for young people in isolated and marginalised communities, experts and teenagers say.

title.children: Vulnerable kids worry a social media ban could be a massive setback for them

image.altText: Six people wearing Australian branded green and white tracksuits smile at the camera. They all have gold medals on their necks.

props.synopsis: Australia's ninth placed finish on this year's Paralympic medal tally continued a downward trend since a table topping performance at Sydney 2000. But with increased funding and a home Games on the horizon, there is a path forward.

title.children: Can Australia re-establish itself as a Paralympic powerhouse?

image.altText: Map showing an intersection on Dynon Road and City Link.

props.synopsis: Safety oversights on Victoria's big build have led to one cyclist dying and another being paralysed. Advocates say neither incident should ever have happened.

title.children: 'Completely preventable tragedies': The lives shattered by safety oversights on Victoria's big build

image.altText: Bullet holes are seen on the front of a Toyota minibus

props.synopsis: Residents of Papua New Guinea's Enga province say they're fearful a "new brand of tribal warfare" has started after gunmen stormed a passenger bus, killing at least six people.

title.children: Seven dead after gunmen ambush public bus in Papua New Guinea and trigger 'new brand' of tribal violence

image.altText: aerial shot of melbourne showing houses and city skyscrapers

props.synopsis: Though it might feel like we've been stuck in the same housing debate forever, in the last two years there has been a quiet revolution.

title.children: Fighting about skyscrapers at train stations is the surest sign the housing debate has shifted

image.altText: An aerial view of a large newly built house in an estate with an open two car garage and green lawns.

props.synopsis: The disagreement is over a proposal to freeze changes to the national construction code for a decade.

title.children: Days after standing behind Peter Dutton, the property lobby has rejected one of his key housing policies

image.altText: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump looking at each other in election illustration

props.synopsis: Election security is ramping up, Donald Trump is preparing to sit down with Joe Rogan, and Rudy Giuliani is ordered to hand over his multi-million-dollar apartment — here's the latest updates from the US election.

title.children: Snipers to protect voting stations, Donald Trump prepares for Joe Rogan appearance — the latest from the US election campaign trail

image.altText: Kim and Putin shaking hands

props.synopsis: Russia, searching for avenues to bolster its war in Ukraine, appears poised to send North Korean troops to the front, in a move described as "a significant escalation".

title.children: North Korea's decision to send troops to Russia puts Ukraine, allies on edge

image.altText: Still from CCTV of a woman in a pinkl singlet reaching out to a baby being held by its mother

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old woman is charged after she allegedly assaulted a baby in a random attack at a Perth shopping centre.

title.children: Woman charged after allegedly attacking baby in random shopping centre assault

image.altText: A grey mouse in a plastic bucket with its face in a spiky stubby banksia flower.

props.synopsis: Flowers can be pollinated in a multitude of ways, and now a series of studies is showing just how big a role rats and mice play when it comes to Australian flora.

title.children: Native and introduced mice are quietly pollinating Australian plants, study shows

image.altText: An older man with sunglasses on his head sits in front of a construction site.

props.synopsis: Mike Jessop has been granted bail by the Supreme Court and is listed as the second candidate on the ballot for the seat of Caloundra.

title.children: Rope, body bag and axe allegedly found in Queensland election candidate's car

image.altText: A close up of a young woman with long dark hair

props.synopsis: Matilda Campbell, 23, has thanked the rescue team who saved her life after she slipped trying to retrieve her mobile phone in the NSW Hunter Valley. She came out of the ordeal with a fractured vertebra and grazes.

title.children: Woman who spent seven hours hanging by her feet in rock crevice 'eternally thankful' for rescue

image.altText: A young girl in a dance costume with a blurred face.

props.synopsis: Two ballet teachers from different schools testify at the trial of a couple accused of starving their teenage daughter, telling the court of their alarm at the girl's gaunt appearance, and their failed attempts to raise the alarm with the parents.

title.children: Severely malnourished teenager was 'fading away' in front of ballet teacher's eyes, trial of parents accused of starvation told

image.altText: Commonwealth Games Australia boss Craig Phillips

props.synopsis: Craig Phillips has fired another shot at the Victorian government, claiming Commonwealth Games Australia never had a chance to present the 10-sport version of the event heading to Glasgow.

title.children: Commonwealth Games Australia boss fires latest shot at Victoria, says state could have 'absolutely' hosted streamlined event

image.altText: A brown snake rearing up with it's mouth open, on red grassy soil.

props.synopsis: A toxicologist warns it's never safe to assume a snake bite is free of venom, after a South Australian man experiences a delayed reaction to poison from a suspected brown snake bite.

title.children: Snake bite victim's 'unusual' 15-hour wait before venom kicks in

image.altText: A smiling woman wears a thick black headband and floral jacket over a hot pink top

props.synopsis: Goorie author Melissa Lucashenko has won one of Australia's richest literary prizes, the ARA Historical Novel Prize, for Edenglassie, which interweaves stories of Aboriginal peoples in the past and present.

title.children: 'The country is changing': Melissa Lucashenko wins $100,000 literary prize for book about colonisation

image.altText: A man wearing a cream blazer and blue tie sits in an armchair with a window behind him as he is interviewed

props.synopsis: WA Premier Roger Cook has called on Port Hedland councillor Adrian McRae to quit after quoting a Nazi and attacking Western media in a recent controversial Russian state television appearance.

title.children: 'An embarrassment': Premier urges WA councillor to resign after quoting a Nazi on Russian TV

image.altText: A woman and man with sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The judge in the trial for a teenager accused of the home-invasion murder of Brisbane woman Emma Lovell has retired to consider his verdict.

title.children: Widower of Brisbane mother speaks of 'difficult' trial as judge retires to consider verdict in murder case

image.altText: Brent Wyndham in police uniform walking in the middle of a group of police officers.

props.synopsis: The family members of an Aboriginal woman shot dead by a police officer who was then acquitted of her murder urge a coroner to consider that the death could have been avoidable.

title.children: Death of woman shot by police could have been avoided, coroner told

image.altText: Mickey the cockatoo in Macarthur Square Shopping Centre walking towards a trolley

props.synopsis: A cockatoo named Mickey became trapped inside Macarthur Square Shopping Centre at Campbelltown in Sydney's south-west last month. He "took up residence" at the Coles supermarket before he was captured by local bird expert yesterday.

title.children: 'She helped me lure him': How bird expert captured cockatoo stuck in supermarket for weeks
